sanskrit_verse:
व्याधांशाकुनिकान् गोपान् कैवर्तान् मूलखानकान् ।
व्यालग्राहानुञ्छवृत्तीनन्यांश्च वनचारिणः ॥ ८.२६०॥
transliteration:
vyādhāṁśākunikān gopān kaivartān mūlakhānakān |
vyālagrāhānuñchavṛttīnan yāṁśca vana cāriṇaḥ || 8.260||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those whose livelihood arises from hunting, bird-catching, herding, fishing, root-gathering, serpent-catching, scavenging, or wandering in forests—these persons are designated as living by marginal survival techniques and must be restored to integrated societal participation through capacity-building.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from consciousness alignment, not occupational status
Causation is traced to lack of access and integration, not individual fault
Capacity-based responsibility requires systemic upliftment over classification
Restoration logic demands inclusion through skill cultivation and social reintegration
Consciousness alignment necessitates removal of structural barriers to dignified existence
executable_legal_axioms: IF occupation = 'marginal survival technique' THEN initiate capacity-building protocol
IF person lacks integration pathway THEN assign societal role with dignity restoration priority
IF livelihood source causes exclusion THEN activate systemic reintegration mechanism
IF behavioral pattern reflects disconnection THEN provide structured consciousness engagement program
IF economic activity is survival-based THEN ensure transition to contributive participation
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any case involving individuals categorized under survival-based occupations must prioritize restoration frameworks that affirm their inherent eligibility for full societal participation, bypassing punitive categorizations and enforcing constitutional alignment with consciousness-first jurisprudence.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that occupational marginalization stems from systemic absence, not personal deficiency; anupūrvaśaḥ traces causal sequence from exclusion to behavior; proportional responsibility lies with integrating structures, not the individual; non-punitive reality rule affirms that misalignment is a call for restoration, not condemnation.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate vocational integration assessment within 7 days of identification
Assign mentorship and skill development plan aligned with innate capacities
Establish community contribution pathway with dignity-preserving support
Activate consciousness engagement sessions to restore self-authority
Monitor progress quarterly and adjust integration framework accordingly
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law: Dharma is restored through conscious reintegration, reality remains non-punitive, and consciousness stands as the ultimate adjudicator.
